questions.text: I feel responsible for keeping peace and harmony between people, even when I'm not asked to.
I put effort into making sure others feel included, accepted, or cared for.
Conflict makes me uncomfortable, and I naturally look for ways to ease tension or restore balance.
I am motivated to act when someone I care about feels disconnected, left out, or unsafe.
I believe the world needs to listen to each other more in order to heal.
I am motivated by a desire to become stronger, more skilled, or more capable in what I do.
I value discipline and persistence, even when progress feels slow.
I enjoy working on a topic until I fully know it.
I love to develop skills by focusing deeply, finding mastery within the details.
I believe that becoming more skillful makes me a better and more complete person.
I think about how my actions affect the larger system, organization, or community.
I feel motivated to make a difference that will last beyond myself.
I measure success by the impact my work has on others or on the future.
I feel driven to influence or shape outcomes at a broader scale, not just for myself.
I believe I have, and want to have, a meaningful impact on the world.
I feel energized by new ideas, experiences, or changes.
I get restless when things feel repetitive, predictable, or stagnant.
I am curious and drawn to experiment, even if the outcome is uncertain.
I am motivated by the excitement of starting something fresh rather than maintaining what already exists.
I believe the world has so much to offer, and I want to explore and experience it all.
I prefer to maintain multiple interests and activities simultaneously rather than focusing on just one.
I find it energizing to juggle different projects or responsibilities at the same time.
I feel constrained when I have to dedicate all my attention to a single area for too long.
Even after being proven wrong, I can still trust my ability to make good decisions in the future.
I tend to recover quickly from mistakes or failures without carrying lasting self-doubt.
When I realize my understanding was flat-out wrong, I use it as learning, not as proof that I can't trust myself.
I can maintain confidence in my judgment even when others strongly disagree with me.
Criticism or setbacks strengthen my resolve rather than making me question everything.
I often delay decisions until I have gathered multiple perspectives or data points.
I feel uneasy acting on instinct alone; I prefer to do some research first.
I enjoy reading, studying, or consulting others before I make an important choice.
I believe more information almost always leads to better decisions.
I actively seek out new information and perspectives, even when I don't immediately need them.
I feel a strong need to share my thoughts and ideas with others.
I process my thinking best by talking it through or writing it out.
I feel frustrated when I have insights or knowledge that I can't share with someone.
